content: विनय {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} Cast, thrown. {@--2@} Secret. {@--3@} Ill-behaved. --यः {@--1@} Guidance, discipline, instruction (in one's duties), moral training; प्रजानां विनयाधानात् <ls>R. 1. 24</ls>; <ls>Māl. 10. 5.</ls> {@--2@} Sense of propriety, decorum, decency; अनुयास्यन्मुनितनयां सहसा विनयेन वारितप्रसरः <ls>Ś. 1. 29.</ls> {@--3@} Polite conduct, gentleman-like bearing, good breeding or manners; <ls>R. 6. 79</ls>; <ls>Māl. 1. 18.</ls> {@--4@} Modesty, humility; सुष्ठु शोभसे आर्यपुत्र एतेन विनयमाहात्म्येन <ls>U. 1</ls>; विद्या ददाति वि नयम्; तथापि नीचैर्विनयाददृश्यत <ls>R. 3. 34</ls>; <ls n="R.">10. 71</ls> (where <ls>Malli.</ls> renders विनय by इंद्रियजय or restraint of passions, unnecessarily in our opinion). {@--5@} Reverence, courtesy, obeisance. {@--6@} Conduct in general. {@--7@} Drawing off, taking away, removing; <ls>Śi. 10. 42.</ls> {@--8@} A man who has subdued his senses. {@--9@} A trader, merchant.
